description.narrative: The Spotlight Initiative in Papua New Guinea COUNTRY PROGRAMME DOCUMENT implemented by the selected United Nations Agencies operating in Papua New Guinea

activity-description.narrative: One of the project target provinces
One of the project target provinces

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Indicator 1.1.1 Number of draft new and/or strengthened laws and/or policies on ending VAWG, including DV/IPV, and/or gender equality and non-discrimination developed that respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination, and are in line with international HR standards
Indicator 2.1.3 Number of strategies, plans and programmes of other relevant sectors that integrate efforts to end VAWG, including DV/IPV, developed in line with international HR standards
Indicator 2.2.1 Proportion of supported multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms established at the highest level and/or strengthened composed of relevant stakeholders, with a clear mandate and governance structure and with annual work plans
Indicator 3.3.5 Number of key informal decision makers and decision makers in relevant non-state institutions with strengthened awareness of and capacities to advocate for implementation of legislation and policies on ending VAWG and for gender-equitable norms, attitudes and behaviors and women and girls’ rights.
Indicator 4.1.2 Number of women and girls with access to programmes developed to integrate VAWG, including DV/IPV, response into SRH, education and migration services
Indicator 4.2.2 Number of women and girls’ survivors and their families, including groups facing multiple and intersecting forms or discrimination, that have increased knowledge of and access to accompaniment/support initiatives, including longer-term recovery services.
Indicator 5.1.1 Number of National Statistical Offices that have developed/adapted and contextualized methods and standards at national level to produce prevalence and/or incidence data on VAWG, including DV/IPV
Indicator 5.2.1 Number of knowledge products developed and disseminated to the relevant stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision making.

comment.narrative: Output 1.1 - Baseline: Draft Operational Framework for the National GBV Secretariat developed in 2019 Output 2.1 - Baseline: Interim GBV Secretariat in place since 2019 Output 2.2 - Baseline: Draft organizational structure of the Nat. GBV Secretariat developed in 2019; zero GBV secretariat established in provinces. Output 3.3 - Baseline: 6 MPS between 2018 and 2019 engaged in discussions on advocacy on GBV prevention. Output 4.1 - Baseline: 0 Output 4.2 - Baseline: 0 Output 5.1 - Baseline: NCDC case management system/data operation but limited Output 5.2 - Baseline: 0

Output 1.1: Number of draft new and/or strengthened laws and/or policies on ending VAWG, including DV/IPV, and/or gender equality and non-discrimination developed that respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination, and are in line with international HR standards
Targets: Endorsement and operationalizing of framework for GBV secretariat.
Output 2.1: Number of strategies, plans and programmes of other relevant sectors that integrate efforts to end VAWG, including DV/IPV, developed in line with international HR standards.
Target: Endorsement of full establishment of GBV Secretariat
Output 2.2: Proportion of supported multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms established at the highest level and/or strengthened composed of relevant stakeholders, with a clear mandate and governance structure and with annual work plans
Target: Finalization the Operational Structure and commencement of recruitment and training of 6 officers from the Department of Community Development and Religion and 20 officers from Provincial Gender-Based Violence Secretariat & Provincial Family and Sexual Violence Action Committees).
Output 3.3: Number of key informal decision makers in relevant non-state institutions with strengthened awareness of and capacities to advocate for implementation of legislation and policies on ending VAWG and for gender-equitable norms, attitudes and behaviours and women and girls’ rights
Target: 30 Members of Parliament, 200 electoral support staff and parliamentary staff, 200 officers in departments where their heads of department or agency is involved, 30 business leaders and CEOs and 3,000 of their staff and workers. Media awareness through radio, TV and print media will be 5,500,000 based on coverage of National Broadcasting Company estimates.
Output 4.1: Number of women and girls with access to programmes developed to integrate VAWG, including DV/IPV, response into SRH, education and migration services.
Target: Establish an effective support system to track IPOs in NDC and 6 targeted provinces.
Output 4.2: Number of women and girls’ survivors and their families, including groups facing multiple and intersecting forms or discrimination, that have increased knowledge of and access to accompaniment/support initiatives, including longer-term recovery services.
Target: Train 30 Village court magistrates and 30 police officers and 40 other officials in 6 target provinces
Output 5.1: Number of National Statistical Offices that have developed/adapted and contextualized methods and standards at national level to produce prevalence and/or incidence data on VAWG, including DV/IPV
Target: Establishment and strengthening of existing case management system in Kokopo and Lae: total of 30 people to receive direct support.
Output 5.2: Number of knowledge products developed and disseminated to the relevant stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision making
Target: Development of M&E system for the National GBV Secretariat.

Output 1.1: Number of draft new and/or strengthened laws and/or policies on ending VAWG, including DV/IPV, and/or gender equality and non-discrimination developed that respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination, and are in line with international HR standards Targets: Endorsement and operationalizing of framework for GBV secretariat. Results: Draft Operational Plan revised but not endorsed by DFCDR management; Work in progress
Output 2.1: Number of strategies, plans and programmes of other relevant sectors that integrate efforts to end VAWG, including DV/IPV, developed in line with international HR standards. Target: Endorsement of full establishment of GBV Secretariat Results: National GBV Secretariat Office established within DFCDR Office; 12 staff positions allocated but not endorsed by Department of Personnel Management; Work in progress
Output 2.2: Proportion of supported multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms established at the highest level and/or strengthened composed of relevant stakeholders, with a clear mandate and governance structure and with annual work plans Target 1: Finalization the Operational Structure and commencement of recruitment and training of 6 officers from the Department of Community Development and Religion and; Result: 3 Target 2: 20 officers from Provincial Gender-Based Violence Secretariat & Provincial Family and Sexual Violence Action Committees). Results: 24
Output 3.3: Number of key informal decision makers in relevant non-state institutions with strengthened awareness of and capacities to advocate for implementation of legislation and policies on ending VAWG and for gender-equitable norms, attitudes and behaviours and women and girls’ rights Target 1: 30 Members of Parliament Result: 20 Coalition members Target 2: 200 electoral support staff and parliamentary staff Result: Work in progress Target 3: 200 officers in departments where their heads of department or agency is involved Result: Work in progress Target 4a: 30 business leaders and CEOs and; Results: Work in progress Target 4b: 3,000 of their staff and workers Result: Work in progress Target 5: Media awareness through radio, TV and print media will be 5,500,000 based on coverage of National Broadcasting Company estimates. Result: Work in progress
Output 4.1: Number of women and girls with access to programmes developed to integrate VAWG, including DV/IPV, response into SRH, education and migration services. Target: Establish an effective support system to track IPOs in NDC and 6 targeted provinces. Result: Established 1 IMS for NCD FSVU and have engaged Kwila Creek to set up IPO tracking tool within the 6 target provinces in 2022
Output 4.2: Number of women and girls’ survivors and their families, including groups facing multiple and intersecting forms or discrimination, that have increased knowledge of and access to accompaniment/support initiatives, including longer-term recovery services. Target 1: Train 30 Village court magistrates and 30 police officers Results: 90 officials (39 females and 51 males) Target 2: 40 other officials in 6 target provinces Results: Work in progress
Output 5.1: Number of National Statistical Offices that have developed/adapted and contextualized methods and standards at national level to produce prevalence and/or incidence data on VAWG, including DV/IPV Target: Establishment and strengthening of existing case management system in Kokopo and Lae: total of 30 people to receive direct support. Results: Work in progress
Output 5.2: Number of knowledge products developed and disseminated to the relevant stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision making Target: Development of M&E system for the National GBV Secretariat. Result: Work in progress

Output 1: Number of draft new and/or strengthened laws and/or policies on ending VAWG, including DV/IPV, and/or gender equality and non-discrimination developed that respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination, and are in line with international HR standards
Targets: Endorsement and operationalizing of framework for GBV secretariat
Output 2.1: Number of strategies, plans and programmes of other relevant sectors that integrate efforts to end VAWG, including DV/IPV, developed in line with international HR standards.
Target: Endorsement of full establishment of GBV Secretariat
Output 2.2: Proportion of supported multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms established at the highest level and/or strengthened composed of relevant stakeholders, with a clear mandate and governance structure and with annual work plans
Target: Finalization the Operational Structure and commencement of recruitment and training of 6 officers from the Department of Community Development and Religion and 20 officers from Provincial Gender-Based Violence Secretariat & Provincial Family and Sexual Violence Action Committees).
Output 3.3: Number of key informal decision makers in relevant non-state institutions with strengthened awareness of and capacities to advocate for implementation of legislation and policies on ending VAWG and for gender-equitable norms, attitudes and behaviours and women and girls’ rights
Target: 30 Members of Parliament, 200 electoral support staff and parliamentary staff, 200 officers in departments where their heads of department or agency is involved, 30 business leaders and CEOs and 3,000 of their staff and workers. Media awareness through radio, TV and print media will be 5,500,000 based on coverage of National Broadcasting Company estimates.
Output 4.1: Number of women and girls with access to programmes developed to integrate VAWG, including DV/IPV, response into SRH, education and migration services.
Target: Establish an effective support system to track IPOs in NDC and 6 targeted provinces.
Output 4.2: Number of women and girls’ survivors and their families, including groups facing multiple and intersecting forms or discrimination, that have increased knowledge of and access to accompaniment/support initiatives, including longer-term recovery services.
Target: Train 30 Village court magistrates and 30 police officers and 40 other officials in 6 target provinces
Output 5.1: Number of National Statistical Offices that have developed/adapted and contextualized methods and standards at national level to produce prevalence and/or incidence data on VAWG, including DV/IPV
Target: Establishment and strengthening of existing case management system in Kokopo and Lae: total of 30 people to receive direct support.
Output 5.2: Number of knowledge products developed and disseminated to the relevant stakeholders to inform evidence-based decision making
Target: Development of M&E system for the National GBV Secretariat.

Results at Output 1.1 = Draft Operational Plan revised but not endorsed by DFCDR management; Work in progress, final results to be achieved in 2021 Results at Output 2.1 = National GBV Secretariat Office established within DFCDR Office; 12 staff positions allocated but not endorsed by Department of Personnel Management; Work in progress, final results to be achieved in 2021 Results at Output 3.3 = Coalition of Parliamentarians on Ending GBV formed in August, 2020 with 20 members of parliament; Special Parliamentary Committee on GBV endorsed by National Parliament in November 2020; Results at Output 4.1 = GBV Information Management System (GBV IMS) developed and officially launched for the Royal PNG Constabulary (RPNGC) Family Sexual Violence Unit (FSVU); GBV IMS to be rolled out to the Courts and Justice Systems; Work in progress, final results to be achieved in 2021 Results at Output 4.2 = Scoping assessments of needs conducted but trainings not rolled out due to COVID-19; Work in progress, results to be achieved in 2021 Results at Output 5.1 = GBV Information Management System developed for RPNGC FSVU yet to be rolled out into provinces; Work in progress, final results to be achieved in 2021 Results at Output 5.2 = M&E specialist conducted and working with National GBV Secretariat to develop a national M&E framework; Work in progress, final results to be achieved in 2021

Output 1.1: Number of draft new and/or strengthened laws and/or policies on ending VAWG, including DV/IPV, and/or gender equality and non-discrimination developed that respond to the rights of women and girls, particularly those facing intersecting and multiple forms of discrimination, and are in line with international HR standards
Targets: Endorsement and operationalizing of framework for GBV secretariat.

Target: Establish an effective support system to track IPOs in NDC and 6 targeted provinces.
Output 4.2: Number of women and girls’ survivors and their families, including groups facing multiple and intersecting forms or discrimination, that have increased knowledge of and access to accompaniment/support initiatives, including longer-term recovery services.
Target: Train 30 Village court magistrates and 30 police officers and 40 other officials in 6 target provinces
Output 5.1: Number of National Statistical Offices that have developed/adapted and contextualized methods and standards at national level to produce prevalence and/or incidence data on VAWG, including DV/IPV
Target: Establishment and strengthening of existing case management system in Kokopo and Lae: total of 30 people to receive direct support.
